answers.answer: Diabetics usually give birth to larger babies. My cousin is diabetic, followed a strict diet her whole pregnancy (only putting on 19 pounds) and took her insulin. Both of her babies were over 10 pounds. She did not have a c-section. It nix depends on ur body n if its able to push out a baby that large. I am not diabetic, but my son was over 9 pounds n 23 inches long...I pushed him out just fine.

Hi there.  It is more then likely the diabetes - most babies born to diabetic moms are bigger then average.  It is also very possible it's just genetics.  Some babies are big.  Remember Dr's tell you all the possible outcomes - that doesn't mean that you will need a c-section. Our bodies are meant to birth babies, and lots of women give birth naturally to big babies.  However, if a c section is necessary, trust me, at the time you probably won't care. When I was told (while in labor) I would need an emergency c section the only thing that mattered to me was that he be here safe and healthy.  That's what happened and at the end of the day, the most important thing.  Congrats on your soon to arrive baby!  Wishing you all the best.

Im also diabetic,  what is ghee?  For breakfast I have a piece if toast with peanut butter or toast and a whole egg not just egg whites. For breakfast I was told to have one carb meaning something with total carbs between 11-22 carbs.   Then a snack (3 choice) one carb 11-22g and another that is 22-37g carbs. And always have protein with each meal. Then lunch the same then one for snack then 3 for dinner and a one choice for a snack before bed. I Havnt had mt final ultrasound but each time I.measure fine.

They can be wrong. I had gestational diabetes and had to be induced for the fear of baby being big. She was only 6lb6 because I followed the diet strictly.Avoid all sugar and white carbs. Ps I had a vaginal birth too so it can be done. All the best xx

question: I have entered my 37th week of pregnancy. my sugar level is on track with diabetic diet and intake of insulin. Regarding my diet am having 2 egg whites and  1 spoon of ghee everyday for past one month as my mom says ghee is good for normal delivery.... But am worried now, today had a doctor check up,everythign is in control but she said , my baby is growing big so to be more active and do all house works... I asked her willthere be any complications if baby goes big. she said no complications but might end up in C section, i prefer normal delivery ,and worst cases only i can opt C section,Please tell me has baby started growing than expected becasue of Ghee or egg white intake...What excersises do i need to do .. wat is the alternate to stop for this  big growth :(please tell me
